programmes.show_description: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis look back on more recent history in the company of guests Catherine Bohart, Ed Byrne, Darren Harriott, Rhys James and Felicity Ward.
Rob Brydon welcomes more wily guests to the deceptive comedy panel show. Joining captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are Robert Webb, Sir Terry Wogan, Katy Wix and Kevin Bridges.
Rob Brydon, Lee Mack and David Mitchell feature in a special episode of out-takes, looking back over some of the best moments.

programmes.show_name: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programmes.show_description: Nobody Wants Vom on Their Cheerios: Amusing musings on 21st century life. Dave ponders whether people's behaviour is the same in the real world as it is online.

programmes.show_name: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programmes.show_description: Spray Gravy: Mirthful musings on life's little foibles. Dave invents a way of minimising the time it takes to listen to your favourite songs.
Shopping from Home.
Shopping from Home.
Officers investigate a collector travelling with parts of a space rocket, and 380 kilograms of crystal meth is discovered in a shipment of limes.
24 kilograms of cocaine are found concealed in the air tank of a truck, and a cache of weapons bound for Mexico is intercepted.
Transit Van: The motoring enthusiast takes his battered transit van to the USA to enter the fastest road race on the planet: the Nevada Open Road Challenge.
Lisbon: Rick Stein visits Lisbon on the banks of the River Tagus, a city in love with its seafood and possibly the best custard tarts in the world.
Border officers in Detroit apprehend a woman after finding a handgun and ammunition in her vehicle, and officers in Eagle Pass find 150,000 dollars' worth of methamphetamine.
Officers find a man-made compartment within the trailer of a truck returning Stateside, and two Americans arouse suspicions with an unsafe lane change at the US-Canada border.
Madagascar: Celebs take on treacherous tracks. Angus Deayton and Mariella Frostrup battle across broken bridges as they drive up Madagascar's eastern coast on roads mired in mud.
Fuel-guzzling fun with Jeremy Clarkson and co. The lads attempt a channel crossing in their amphibious vehicles. Jools Holland has a hoot-enanny in the Reasonably Priced Car.
Motoring news and controversial views. Jeremy drives the smallest car ever made and Richard races a Bugatti Veyron against the RAF's Typhoon jet fighter. Ronnie Wood guests.
UK 2: The Bikers head to Bromsgrove for some of the best jerk chicken around and to Birmingham for a balti before making piri piri chicken at the Womad festival.
Lisbon: Rick Stein visits Lisbon on the banks of the River Tagus, a city in love with its seafood and possibly the best custard tarts in the world.
Rob Brydon hosts a festive edition from 2016, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by panellists Richard Osman, Tom Courtenay, Sara Pascoe and Chris Kamara.
Sian Gibson, Jean Johansson, Iain Stirling and Rav Wilding make another trip into the Thursday Murder Club creator's quizzing den and try to earn glory this time around.
Former winners Tim Key, Jamie Laing, Sunetra Sarker and Laura Whitmore join the Pointless friend to see which of them will become a Champion of Champions.
Germany: High-spirited comedy quiz. Stephen Fry goes 'Deutsch' with Jo Brand, Rob Brydon, Sean Lock and Alan Davies, no doubt indulging in some schadenfreude when the klaxon sounds.

programmes.show_name: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programmes.show_description: Richard Ayoade guest hosts the satirical news quiz, with panellists Roisin Conaty and Armando Iannucci joining regulars Paul Merton and Ian Hislop.
The Pendulum Draws The Eye: Two episodes remain in the series and with Greg Davies's shiny head trophy within touching distance, tensions are beginning to run high between the contestants.
Tall tales from celebrity panellists. Host Rob Brydon and regulars David Mitchell and Lee Mack welcome guests David O'Doherty, Katherine Parkinson, Bill Turnbull and Louie Spence.
Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis look back on news gone by in the company of guests Maisie Adam, Angela Barnes, Rhys James, Robin Morgan and Ahir Shah.
Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis excavate the treasures of the past with the help of guests Maisie Adam, Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones and Kae Kurd.

programmes.show_name: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programmes.show_description: Like Top Gun All Over Again: Can a knock-off can ever be as good as the real thing? Comedian Dave Gorman offers some wry observations on DVDs, baking - and Bucks Fizz.

programmes.show_name: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programmes.show_description: I've Never Seen a Cat: One very funny man and his laptop. Dave plays tricks with singing toys, interrogates kids' TV characters, and messes with Monopoly.
Shopping from Home.
Shopping from Home.
Officers intercept a shipment of hundreds of gun parts headed for Mexico, a nurse is caught smuggling pills in her boots, and a traveller carrying goat meat is inspected.
A tip-off unearths a vast shipment of heroin and cocaine disguised as garbage bags, and officers respond to a medical emergency and deal with a drunken US Marshal.
Pedal-Powered Airship: The motoring fan tries to become the first person to cross the English Channel in a human-powered airship by pedalling a bike suspended from a helium-filled balloon.
Copenhagen: Rick Stein visits Copenhagen, the home of new Nordic cuisine, and cooks fried pork belly with lovage potatoes and parsley sauce, a dish once named as Denmark's favourite.
Officers at Eagle Pass intercept a driver smuggling narcotics over the border, and a group of passengers in Laredo refuse to admit to owning an air compressor full of rifles.
Officers in Progreso detain a man who made a dash back toward Mexico, and the team in Laredo uncovers methamphetamine concealed in a shipment of landscaping stone.
Georgia: Twenty Twelve co-stars Hugh Bonneville and Jessica Hynes face an Olympic-sized task as they take a terrifying road trip through the deadly, winding mountains of Georgia.
High-speed high-jinks - and high trousers - with Clarkson and co, who are joined by pop mogul Simon Cowell. The lads race each other across London using a bike, a boat and a car.
Plenty of fast cars, but no fracas... Richard and James get together some ageing camper vans and a small troop of touring car drivers for Top Gear's inaugural Motorhome Grand Prix!
Hong Kong: The Hairy Bikers are back, touring the birthplaces of favourite Asian cuisines. In Hong Kong they discover the secrets of wok chi at a street food stall.
Copenhagen: Rick Stein visits Copenhagen, the home of new Nordic cuisine, and cooks fried pork belly with lovage potatoes and parsley sauce, a dish once named as Denmark's favourite.
With comedian David Baddiel, former MP Ed Balls, stand-up and actress Jo Brand and ex-Pussycat Doll Kimberly Wyatt.
Sian Gibson, Jean Johansson, Iain Stirling and Rav Wilding make another trip into the Thursday Murder Club creator's quizzing den and try to earn glory this time around.
Former winners Tim Key, Jamie Laing, Sunetra Sarker and Laura Whitmore join the Pointless friend to see which of them will become a Champion of Champions.
Gallimaufrey: Being quite interesting wins points in the offbeat comedy quiz. Stephen Fry introduces Phill Jupitus, Hugh Dennis and Andy Hamilton to a gallimaufrey of gingambobs.

programmes.show_name: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programmes.show_description: Guest host Victoria Coren Mitchell and panellists Joan Bakewell and Fin Taylor join team captain Paul Merton and Ian Hislop.
I Can Hear It Gooping: The series reaches its majestic climax. Who will win Greg Davies's coveted golden head to become just the seventh Taskmaster Champion in history?
